Title: Your Love is A Song
A simple chord sheet. These are the basic chords I use for supplementary instruments and piano.
THE SOUND (JOHN M. PERKINS BLUES) - Switchfoot
Here's all the main rhythm guitar parts, I'll get that weird solo and maybe the little
Main Riff for intro, verses, bridge, outro
During the parts of the verse where they sing "oh, oh, oh," don't palm mute
Pre-Chorus ("Can you hear it rise up from the ground?") chords
Chorus Part I ("This is the sound!")
Repeat the verse again, and note that the guitar drops out at a couple parts
At part II, another guitar part comes in. I believe Drew is using a Digitech Whammy here
to one octave up and playing this
(I think the slide-up is simulated by the Whammy btw)
If you don't own a Whammy (and I suggest buying one because they're loads of fun), you
play this. It won't sound quite the same, though.
Play the main riff for the solo, with some variations on what's palm-muted
The last time part II is played, Drew changes up the Whammy thing a little and plays
(if you stink at bending, just sliding up to the 7 is fine)
Play through the riff a few more times without the palm mute, and end on that last note
the 10th fret of the low E (or D, whatever you want to call it)
I might the rest later, but you have all the parts that are actually worth knowing for now!
Boom... The Static comes in slow
We run as thick as blood
This is the sound of a heartbeat
This is the sound of the discontented mouths
We are the voice of breaking down
This is the sound of the desperation bound

this is the sound of the discontented mouths
we are the voice of breaking down

we are the voice of breaking down

Of a haunted nation, we are the voice of breaking down

by our condition, we are the voice of breaking down

These are the chords from Switchfoot's new song "Hello Hurricane" from their
upcoming album/release Hello Hurricane -- due out in September '09.
Guitar 1: Standard (E A D G B E) - Mandolin to Guitar
Guitar 2: Standard (E A D G B E) - Guitar (Electric)
Guitar 3: Stamdard (E A D G B E) - Keyboard to Guitar
*Chords are listed at end of song
NOTE: This chord sounds more like a mandolin in my opinion.
You can't silence my love My love
Every thing I have I count as loss
Everything I have is stripped away
There's nothing left for you to take away
Tuning - Standard (E A D G B E)
*Chords are listed at end of song
C F Am G OR Gsus4 Em G/B
Tuning - Drop D (D A D G B E)
I wanna take it for all the dreamers

Here's one for the friction makers
I wanna turn up the radiation
I wanna glow in the dark
Love is the one truth in relation

might be able to get away with just playing the single notes.

The guitar bit for the intro and much of the verses is just a D5 alternating with
the same chord except you slide your finger from the D on the A string to the C# on the A string.
